Label: MHC chain expression evidence
Evidence: ('is about' some ('MHC class I chain' or 'MHC class II chain'))
Definition: Evidence about the level of MHC class I or class I chain expression observed in a population.

Label: evidence of MHC chain expression not observed
Definition: A type of chain expression evidence where the chain expression is not observed in the population.

Label: evidence of MHC chain expression observed
Definition: A type of chain expression evidence where the chain expression is observed in the population.

Label: evidence of MHC chain expression observed in >1% of the population
Definition: A type of chain expression evidence where the chain expression is observed in more than 1% of the population.

Label: evidence of MHC chain expression questionable
Definition: A type of chain expression evidence where the chain expression is questionable in the population.

Label: inferred MHC restriction based on MHC binding prediction
Is Supported By Data: assay measuring binding of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex
Definition: An inferred MHC restriction determined by predictive analysis of the epitope-MHC interaction, based upon the sequence or structure of the epitope without experimental assay.
Example of Usage: The use of the NetCTLPan prediction software to determine the likely MHC restriction of a peptide.

Label: inferred MHC restriction based on MHC ligand assay
Definition: An inferred MHC restriction determined by a positive outcome in a MHC ligand assay.
Example of Usage: The epitope was believed to be HLA-A*02:03 restricted because it bound HLA-A*02:03 with high affinity in an assay where the peptide concentration inhibiting 50% of the specific binding to the MHc molecule was measured.

Label: inferred MHC restriction based on pattern of donor reactivity with different MHC in T cell assay
Is Supported By Data: assay measuring binding of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex
Definition: An inferred MHC restriction determined by the association of a positive outcome in a T cell assay with the presence of certain alleles within the responding population.
Example of Usage: When all responding T cell donors were found to express HLA-A*02:01, the epitope was presumed to be HLA-A*02:01 restricted.

Label: inferred MHC restriction based on pattern of reactivity of same T cells with different MHC in T cell assay
Is Supported By Data: assay measuring binding of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex
Definition: An inferred MHC restriction determined by a positive outcome in a T cell assay when APC expressing specific MHC were used and a negative response with APC not expressing the specific MHC.
Example of Usage: The epitope was determined to be Patr-B*02:01 restricted when APC expressing Patr-B*02:01 caused T cells to produce cytokines and APC lacking this molecule resulted in no cytokine response.

Label: inferred MHC restriction based on set of MHC  available in T cell assay
Is Supported By Data: assay measuring binding of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex
Definition: An inferred MHC restriction determined by the reduction or loss of a positive outcome in a T cell assay when subsets of MHC bearing APC were blocked.
Example of Usage: The loss of T cell response when anti-DR antibody was added to the assay resulted in the belief that the antigen is DR restricted.

Label: inferred MHC restriction based on single MHC available in T cell assay
IEDB Label: T cell assay -Single MHC type present
Is Supported By Data: assay measuring binding of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex
Definition: An inferred MHC restriction determined by a positive outcome in a T cell assay where the antigen presenting cell (or tetramer/multimer) expressed only a single MHC molecule.
Example of Usage: Because the T cells proliferated in reponse to epitope loaded APC expressing only BoLA-DRB3*1201, the epitope was inferred to be BoLA-DRB3*1201 restricted.

Label: inferred MHC restriction based on traceable author statement
Evidence: author statement supported by traceable reference
Definition: An inferred MHC restriction determined by an author's statement that the restriction of the epitope was already known prior to their publication.
Example of Usage: The description of the peptide as being "a well-characterized H-2-IAg7 restricted epitope" in a publication resulted in this belief.

Label: inferred MHC restriction based on type of biological process measured in T cell assay
Is Supported By Data: T cell epitope dependent biological activity assay
Definition: An inferred MHC restriction determined by a positive outcome in a T cell assay where the response  measured is indicative of a certain T cell subset.
Example of Usage: The epitope was believed to be Class II restricted because the T cells produced IL-5 when incubated with the epitope.

Label: inferred MHC restriction based on type of effector T cell utilized in T cell assay
IEDB Label: T cell assay -T cell subset identification
Is Supported By Data: assay measuring binding of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex
Definition: An inferred MHC restriction determined by a positive outcome in a T cell assay using specific T cell subsets as effector cells or by a negative outcome when a spceific subset is blocked by antibodies.
Example of Usage: Because a T cell response was only detectable with CD8+ T cells and not CD4+ T cells, the antigen is believed to be MHC Class I restricted.

Label: inferred MHC restriction evidence
Evidence: ('is about' some ('MHC protein complex' and (bound_to some epitope)))
Definition: Evidence about the restriction of some MHC protein complex that is bound to some epitope.
Comment: Coordination between OBI and ECO is work-in-progress. In OBI, the inferred restriction is modelled as a 'conclusion based on data'.
